a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif;font-weight:500

text.tspan: Death rate from air pollution, World, 1990 to 2019
Death rates are given as the number of attributed deaths from pollution per 100,000 population. These rates are
age-standardized, meaning they assume a constant age structure of the population: this allows for comparison
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2019)
